data.title: The Commander’s Orders: Serve!
data.solution:
# Chief’s Orders: Serve tables marked 'H'. Fail not!!!

rows = int(input())  # Number of rows in the field of operations
H = False  # Flag to track hungry soldiers

# Scan the field row by row
for i in range(rows):
    row = input()  # Status of each table (F or H)

    # Inspect each table in the row
    for j, table in enumerate(row):
        if table == "H":  # Found a hungry table
            print(f"Table {i}{j}, served!")  # Report the table as served
            H = True  # Mark that we served at least one table

# Final report to the Chief
if H:
    print("No more hungry soldiers, Chief!!!")  # Victory report
else:
    print("All tables clear, Chief!!!")  # All is well on the battlefield
data.statement:
<<Serve food to every table marked '{{H}}'! Miss one, and the men go hungry!!!>>

You need to serve tables marked with "{{H}}" for hungry soldiers.
For each table served, print its position with row and column indexes.
The output should be in order from top to bottom, left to right (rows first, then columns).
Indexing of rows and columns starts from 0.

Your reply:
Aye aye, Captain!

Table 11, served!
Table 23, served!
No more hungry soldiers, Chief!!!

data.stubGenerator:
read rows:int
loop rows read row:string(1024)
write Report back to the Chief!
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1>>: An integer [[rows]] for the number of rows of tables.
<<Next [[rows]] lines>>: A string [[row]] for a row of tables which consists of characters of either {{F}} or {{H}}. {{H}} marks a table needing food.
data.outputDescription:
<<One line for every table to serve:>> "{{Table [[XY]], served!}}" → [[X]] = row, [[Y]] = column.
<<Last line:>> "{{No more hungry soldiers, Chief!!!}}", when food is served to all hungry soldiers.
OR
<<Line 1:>> "{{All tables clear, Chief!!!}}", when no soldier is hungry.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Serve food to every table marked 'H'! Miss one, and the men go hungry!!!

You need to serve tables marked with "H" for hungry soldiers.
For each table served, print its position with row and column indexes.
The output should be in order from top to bottom, left to right (rows first, then columns).
Indexing of rows and columns starts from 0.

Your reply:
Aye aye, Captain!
Input
Line 1: An integer rows for the number of rows of tables.
Next rows lines: A string row for a row of tables which consists of characters of either F or H. H marks a table needing food.
Output
One line for every table to serve: "Table XY, served!" → X = row, Y = column.
Last line: "No more hungry soldiers, Chief!!!", when food is served to all hungry soldiers.
OR
Line 1: "All tables clear, Chief!!!", when no soldier is hungry.
Constraints
1 ≤ rows ≤ 10
0 ≤ X, Y ≤ 9
Example
Input
3
FFFHF
FHFFF
FFFHF
Output
Table 03, served!
Table 11, served!
Table 23, served!
No more hungry soldiers, Chief!!!
